text.h4: Rank the forces that the central star places on the planets shown above from greatest to least. Their relative masses are given in red.
text.p: To rank them: use the letters A-E and the symbols = and >. For example, A = B > C means "A and B experience the same force, and they both experience a greater force than C." If you believe that they cannot all be ranked, select from one of the reasons below and put the corresponding reason number into the bottom row (be sure to leave the top row blank).

Reason 1: Information about the mass of the central star is needed in order to compare the forces.
Reason 2: The force changes depending on where along the orbit the planet is, so the rankings will not be possible.
Reason 3: The kinetic energy of each of the planets is constant because the Work done by the force is zero (it is perpendicular to the planets' path) therefore no information about the force can be extracted.
